intro: Antennaria howellii, commonly known as Howell's mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant has hairy, low-growing stems and produces tiny, white to pale yellow florets. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Antennaria howellii is an important part of local ecosystems, providing nectar for pollinators and stabilizing soil in arid environments.
